1.text: Thou shalt not take up a false report: thou shalt not put thy hand with the unjust one to be a witness of wrong.

2.text: Thou shalt not be after multitudes for evil; thou shalt not answer for the multitude to stretch out after multitudes to pervert justice.

3.text: And the poor one thou shalt not make proud in his cause.

4.text: If thou shalt meet thine enemy’s ox or his ass wandering, turning back, thou shalt turn him back to him.

5.text: If thou shalt see the ass of him hating thee, lying down under his load, and thou didst desist from cutting loose for him, releasing, thou shall release with him.

6.text: Thou shalt not pervert the judgment of thy needy in his cause.

7.text: From the word of falsehood thou shalt go far away; and the innocent and the just one thou shalt not kill: for I will not justify the unjust one.

8.text: And thou shalt not take a gift; for the gift will blind the seeing, and will pervert just words.

9.text: Thou shalt not press the stranger: and ye knew the soul of the stranger, for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.

10.text: Six years shalt thou sow thy land, and gather its produce:

11.text: And the seventh thou shalt remit, and let it be; and the poor of thy people shall eat; and the remains, the beast of the field shall eat. So shalt thou do to thy vineyard and to thy olive tree.

12.text: Six days thou shalt do thy works, and in the seventh day thou shalt rest: that thine ox shall rest, and thine ass, and the son of thy maid shall be refreshed, and the stranger.

13.text: And in all which I said to you ye shall watch; and ye shall not call to mind the name of other gods; it shall not be heard above thy mouth.

14.text: Three times thou shalt keep a festival to me in the year.

15.text: Thou shalt watch the festival of unleavened: seven days shalt thou eat unleavened as I commanded thee according to the appointment of the month Abib; for in it thou camest forth out of Egypt: and they shall not be seen before me empty.

16.text: And the festival of the harvest, the first fruits of thy works, which thou shalt sow in the field: and the festival of gathering in the going out of the year, in thy gathering thy works out of the field.

17.text: Three times in the year every male of thine shall be seen to the face of the Lord Jehovah.

18.text: Thou shalt not sacrifice upon leaven: the blood of my sacrifice, and the fat of my festival shall not remain over till morning.

19.text: The sacrifice of the first fruits of thy land thou shalt bring to the house of Jehovah thy God. Thou shalt not boil a kid in his mother’s milk.

20.text: Behold, I send a messenger before thee to guard thee in the way, and to bring thee to the place which I prepared.

21.text: Watch from his face, and hear to his voice; thou shalt not rebel against him: he will not lift up your transgression; for my name is in the midst of him.

22.text: For if hearing thou shalt hear to his voice, and to all that I shall speak; and I was an enemy to thine enemies, and I was hostile to thine adversaries.

23.text: For my messenger shall go before thee, and bring thee to the Amorites, and the Hittites and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, the Hivites and the Jebusites; and I destroyed them.

24.text: Thou shalt not worship to their gods, and thou shalt not serve them, and thou shalt not do according to their works: for destroying, thou shalt destroy them, and breaking, thou shalt break in pieces their pillars.

25.text: And serve ye Jehovah your God, and he blessed thy bread, and thy waters; and I turned away disease from the midst of thee.

26.text: And there shall not be bereaving of children or barren upon thy land: the number of thy days I will fill up.

27.text: I will send my terror before thee and I killed all the people which thou shalt come to them; and I gave all thine enemies the back to thee.

28.text: And I sent hornets before thee and to drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite from before thee.

29.text: I will not drive them out from thy face in one year, lest the land shall be desolate, and the beast of the field multiply upon thee.

30.text: By little and little I will drive them out from thy face, till when thou shalt be fruitful and thou didst inherit the land.

31.text: And I put thy bounds from the sea of sedge, and even to the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert even to the river: for I will give into your hand those inhabiting the land, and thou drove them out from before thee.

32.text: Thou shalt not make a covenant with them and to their gods.

33.text: They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they shall cause thee to sin against me: if thou shalt serve their gods, surely shall it be to thee for a snare.
